Reviews.Title: “11 nights with great comfort”
Reviews.Author: faysal-farooqi
Reviews.Content: Small hotel but very spacious rooms. Very friendly staff. Very near to shops & restaurants. Taxis are always there round the clock. Real worth of the money. Rates too are very affordable. Free wi-fi is the additional facility. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: Hebburnmagpie
Reviews.Content: Only stayed the one night we were in Dubai, but we were only 15 minute walk from the creek and marina. The room which was a studio was very spacious and clean. Staff very helpful. Will definitely stay here again on our next visit to dubai.

Reviews.Title: “9 nights in Savoy Park”
Reviews.Author: lperamaki
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, great service. I can definately recommend the hotel in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great price we enjoyed our stay and would recommend to thers”
Reviews.Content: Good value, great service, totally helpfull staff, nice pool, great location. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “4 days/night Dubai - alone”
Reviews.Author: Perthi1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel to participate in the 10k Dubai run & combined with sightseeing. Great value for money, centrally located, good breakfast buffet,easy reachable by metro (10 min walk), big bus tours (stop 5 min away). Minus points are: - shower water has to be heated up before taking a shower (ca. 15 min before) - Noisy as walls and doors seem not to be very solid. Eg. Heard people talking in the next room and walking in the corridor

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adisave
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Savoy Park with family, including one child & one infant. A very pleasant stay. The service was excellent, prompt & without exception, very friendly. The breakfast in the coffee shop isnt a great spread, but its adequate & the staff is very friendly. The room was very clean & maintained well. There isnt a great view from the windows, but then, dont expect to stay in teh room too much when in Dubai ! The rooms are equipped with a small kitchen area, with a microwave, a fridge, some utensils & cutlery. Comes in very handy when u are travelling with kids & when u need to store some backup food & milk in the room. They also have washing machines in the basement, for complimentary use ! The location is okay. Its min cab fare from 2 metro stations & is close to shopping areas like Karama & Meena Bazar. Most cabbies arent aware of the exact location of the hotel, so make sure u carry a map or set of directions with u.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrea H
Reviews.Content: i stayed here in March with my sister in law,we found it a good base to get around, the room had a microwave if you need it we did'nt use it.The hotel has a roof top swimming pool which we used each morning and then went out for the rest of the day.The breakfast was a goid choice.The train station is about 10 minutes walk away and is easy to use.We caught the monorail from one end to the other to get our bearings and were surprised how big the city actually is.The shopping malls are fantastic,which also included Next,Boots,New look and a few more,the prices are more expensive than at home.We enjoyed watching the fountains by the Burj Khalifa they should be seen.The public beach near to Burj Al Arab is a lovely beach.We visited so many places i could be writing for ages,please ask any questions and i will give you an honest opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A valued-price hotel apartment in a quiet quarter”
Reviews.Author: MariaCB
Reviews.Content: The Savoy Park, of the Savoy group of three hotel apartments, is perhaps the most unassuming and value-priced of all. Nonetheless, it undeniably satisfied my requirements, excepting maybe for the WiFi internet connection with a reasonable speed in the morning (8, 77 Mbps), then dropping (2, 55 Mbps) and fluctuating in the late afternoon. But other than that I had no complaints. Mr. Karim, the hotel manager, arranged for a shuttle to pick me up at the airport at a price of 35 dirhams, which is less than the cost of a taxi fare between 40 and 45 dirhams from the airport to the same area in Bur Dubai. Check-in was fast and easy and the staff were helpful and friendly. The complimentary dates in the lobby are worth mentioning because they are delicious. My studio apartment, with a balcony facing the street and flooded by Dubai’s radiating morning sun, was very spacious with a double bed, a kitchenette, a flat-screen TV, a sofa and a work desk. I liked the decoration of the room, which I found very sober and attractive. The kitchenette was well equipped with a big refrigerator, an electric kettle, a toaster, a two-plate stove and a microwave. I couldn’t possibly wish for more. Local landline calls are complimentary and so is parking for hotel guests. In general, the staff were very courteous and helpful. I was impressed with the young Nepalese, Raj Kumar, who was tireless in his efforts to clean my room at the time I had asked for, always leaving everything spotless. The roof pool was luckily never crowded and offered the opportunity to bask in the sun without being too torrid (Christmas season) on the days that were a bit windy at the beach. The Bur Dubai area, where all three Savoy hotel apartments are located, is one of my favourites. It is a quiet quarter far from the hustle and bustle of the nearby commercial streets, suitable for noise-sensitive people and with the appearance of a residential area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: praphatsorn_psc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in a cleaned Studio which fully kitchen and also bigger than we had in many countries. With 10 min. walking to the metro while many Taxi are available in front of the hotel made more convenient for us. The hotel has both European breakfast and delicious arabian foods(changeable manu on each morning). Everything is great especially great host made us feel like their friends. The staffs are all nice and polite. They do take care the guests every steps without asking. We were quite happy to be here. Do hope to be back to see all of again. Thanks for all staffs that made us stayed like a home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ERAN_Colombo
Reviews.Content: Well the hotel was really good in terms of value for money. Location wise i would say it was ok but the thing is although close to burjumman center its not easy walking distance due to construction and the roads. We went in September and the heat was killing us. So had to take a cab wherever we went. Breakfast was superb. They served a very indianish arabic breakfast with a european touch with Spanish omelette's toasts etc. And its complementary. We saved alot of money by shopping at the supermarket on the road behind the hotel. The kitchenette contains everything you need to make a small meal. Even the al la cart menu was also great. Swimming pool isnt that big so dont expect much from that. Rooms were huge contains 3 beds. Staffs are really friendly and helpful. Try to go and check out AT THE TOP which was like the cherry on the top of the excellent trip. Also try to catch a ride on Gold Class Metro which is so much better than the other one.

Reviews.Title: “Old rooms - overrated”
Reviews.Author: almuhalhal
Reviews.Content: This is is an overrated dated hotel. I stayed there based on other reviews and disappointed. Rooms (so called studio) are small to dubai standard. Disasturly tiny bathroom. Sofa and chairs where full of stains. Booked 5 nights but left after 2nd night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Shashi K
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my Family. It was an awesome experience for 3 days. The rooms were very large & they had Wi-Fi as complimentary. Breakfast too was complimentary. The location is in Midst of Residential Area & few min walk from the Famous BurJuman mall. I stayed here in Fab 2011 & it was a very good experience stay for me. Staff was mostly all Indian so very comfortable. They were very courtious & Polite.Being in Residential area its a very quite hotel. Food is quite OK, dont expect too much. Little costly & you may Dine at local resto's which are within few min walk from here. I m not used to stay much in Room, as we spent most of the time outside, but staying here was an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “out dated apart hotel”
Reviews.Author: matmueller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for one night until we booked another one. The hotel is quite boring. There is no food and drinks supply at the pool. The rooms have a kitchen inside so this would be a benefit for a long term stay. We booked the hotel via Arabian Adventure and found it afterwards 50% cheaper on Agoda. The staff is friendly and the were open to talk with us regarding our situation of unhappiness but Arabian Adventure offered us another hotel of the chain for additional costs which would be quite high. It took ages until we received our food in the hotel restaurant even we were the only guests. The interior is old and nothing special. There is a small balcony which is useless. There is no atmosphere in the hotel and no meeting point.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel apartment in Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: sujnaik
Reviews.Content: The Savoy Park Hotel in Bur Dubai is located at walking distance from Burjuman Shopping Centre and Khalid Bin Al Waleed Metro station, which is quite convenient to travel around Dubai. The hotel has Studio rooms with kitchenette which proved quite handy to make our own breakfast. The room was clean and spacious. It had amenities such as LCD TV, key card access (which did not work initially), individual AC controls, kitchen utensils, tea/coffee maker, microwave, toaster, refrigerator and hot plate. The hotel has a small gym for quick workout and a rooftop swimming pool with good views of Dubai. Overall, it is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good, no problems.”
Reviews.Author: mrdom
Reviews.Content: I got a big room with kitchen facilities and a balcony (not much use in summer) for less than $70 a night. Bathroom good but heater needed to be turned on 20 minutes before showering. Free laundry, decent pool. Cafe good but breakfast not included. Staff were fine. Location is ok for the old town but it's a taxi to anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: ArabianAussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Savoy Park Hotel Apartments in one of their studio apartments. It had a small kitchen (no oven), king size bed, couch and TV. Our buffet breakfast was included everyday. The apartment was clean and for the price was very good value. We stayed on a nonsmoking floor and we never smelt cigarette smoke while we were there which was great. Whilst the hotel apartments were not anything amazing the staff are what make this hotel....always so helpful, kind and generous. We stayed for about a month while we were trying to find an apartment to rent. The free internet in the rooms was brilliant....very fast! The only downside to our stay was that we found the bed a bit hard! Thank you Savoy Park for a wonderful stay and a lovely 1st month in Dubai! We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: philly02
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. Rooms were ok, clean and spacious. When we booked we asked for a smoking room but when we arrived we were given a no smoking room. I asked if it could be changed and was informed that there were no other rooms available but would change the next day at 1 o'clock. I was told to wait in my room at 1 o'clock and woud receive a telephone call telling me which room I would be moving to. By 3.45 I had still not received a call, (having made at least three calls to reception) and I asked to speak to someone in authority but was fobbed off and told the new room was ready. Not a very good start. Most of the staff were really good, always smiling and ready to help. On the last day we decided to have lunch delivered by room service and my husband went to the cafe and ordered and paid for it. He was told that it would be delivered within 30 minutes which was fine but after an hour he had to go back downstairs and ask why it had not been delivered. He was told that it would be sent up soon!!!!!! This is not what I would call good service. Sleep quality was not great because there was a lot of banging of doors during the night but you have to remember that a lot of flights leave during the night from dubai so people are coming and going all the time. I suppose the saying "you only get what you pay for" is true in this case. A very mediocre hotel, the only really good thing about it was the location.

Reviews.Title: “good value budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: birchy136
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in february for a week with my father and found the hotel to be good value for money, the service was second to none with very helpful staff and the breakfast was adequate. i had to go to another hotel to have a drink and watch the footy but that was no problem as it was 2 mins walk away-the hotel is in a good location for the creek and for the malls and the burj khalifa is a taxi ride away-taxis are very cheap in dubai. rooms were cleaned everyday and the linen was changed every other day-the rooms were basic but again, adequate-i would reccomend this hotel as a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable and purpose driven place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SriCethar
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this place in February 2011. Nice place, comfortable, friendly staff. Close to the busy business districts. Negative - Rather slow response if we need some room service. Otherwise, the staff are extremely nice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, but city center.”
Reviews.Author: jsd1399
Reviews.Content: We had a front room with balconey, but the traffic noise was min. The bed was large and comfortable. The free wifi kept us in touch. There was a Spinney's grocery 5 min. away on foot with rest. and shops along the same street. The bath was small and a little dated, but how much time do you spend in the bath? Everything worked in the tiny kitchen area and was fine for breakfast and snacks. The refrig. with freezer operated great. It was a short taxi ride to 3 different metro stations, a mall and Dubai Creek. We were interested in enjoying each other and not flashy surroundings. The day we checked out, the hotel was full and could not give us a late check out, but the pool area was available and we had a lovely afternoon under their canopy with a nice breeze. We couldn't have been happier or felt more safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: sethi_sakshi
Reviews.Content: Me and husband have stayed in this hotel apartment for 2 months when we moved to Dubai. They have very good rates for long term stay and their service is absolutely fantastic. We had surveyed a lot of hotels in this area and this turned out to be the cheapest with the best service. The staff in this hotel is extremely polite and helpful. Even at midnight they are ready to resolve any problem that you may have. The linen and furniture in the rooms are clean and new and they take atmost care regarding cleanliness. They have fully functional kitchen with all the important utensils and appliances. Its the best option if someone wants to stay in bur dubai either shorttime or longtime

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Memorable”
Reviews.Author: Akwuma
Reviews.Content: The room at Savoy Park Hotel Apartments was spacious and clean with a flat screen television and cable. A nice balcony as well. One thing I enjoyed was the free internet service in the rooms, simply great for us. The service was top notch and the staff very helpful and courteous. My wife particularly appreciated the fact that the staff were good with children and our daughters had a swell time. Room service were prompt and did the room nicely every time and the staff were particularly helpful when we required information on places to visit and how to get there. The swimming pool was great and well maintained as well. The hotel is located in Burj Dubai, which is centrally located between the busy Diera and the more exclusive Palm Jumeirah areas of the city. The area is quiet and taxi's are available in front of the hotel. The reception staff would be glad to get one for you should you so require. On the whole we enjoyed our two week stay and would recommend it to anyone. What I liked the most was the simple thoughtful and way the staff did certain little things before we asked or even before we knew we needed it that made our stay pleasant and memorable. It was our 3rd trip to Dubai so I know the difference! No unpleasant incident in our entire 2 week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best value accomodation in Dubai with unparalleled service”
Reviews.Author: Overniter
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 of us and daughter aged 21) stayed here for 8 nights on a family holiday. Hotel was comfortable, well appointed and in a really convenient location in Bur Dubai...close to Bur Juman centre, Meena bazaar and other shopping areas. Taxis plentiful and available at your doorstep 24/7. The level of service from the extremely polite and well-trained staff was unparallled in my travelling experience. Breakfast buffet was excellent and with a wide variety of dishes catering to both Asian and western visitors. The excellent value-for-money accomodation was reflected in the occupancy rate of 95% ......even though it was off-season! Guests (while we were there) ranged from business execs to a school football team from the UK. One big plus from our point was the free laundry in the basement of the hotel which meant we did not need to carry very many changes of clothes. Even though it was free, you could count on the staff to assist with removing clothes and putting them in the dryer for you! The rooms had free Wi-Fi but we did not have a laptop so we used the hotel internet (not cheap...Dhs 10 per hour) but free internet facilities (unlike in Singapore) is not the norm in Dubai. Room service was good and the menu covered Indian dishes with a few others to cater to other palates (Fish n chips, club sandwiches, noodles etc). Food was well presented and tasty...good size serves! If I had to travel to Dubai again (work or leisure), I would definitely stay here again and strongly recommend this hotel to anyone interested in staying in Dubai! Oh yes...they do book tours as well and offer daily (free) shuttle bus trips to the nearest Metro station and to some beaches! All-in-all, our hotel stay was the high-light of our visit to Dubai this year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: planetravel
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious, clean, comfortable and well furnished, flat screen cable TV, well-equipped kitchenette, free wireless, swimming pool, sauna and fitness center. Conveniently located close to supermarkets, pharmacies, etc, not the fanciest area of Dubai, but a truly good value for the price paid. Restaurant provided good food at reasonable prices. Staff was very nice and helpful, complimentary tea/coffee and cookies from 4:30pm-5:30pm.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: karanrai
Reviews.Content: This apartment hotel is situated in Bur Dubai and is the only hotel in that area which is suitable for business and family. The strict rule on not getting guests in the room makes it a safe place for families. Very clean and comfortable. Ideal for short stays especially while on a business trip. I personally know of people who have spent 20 days together there while searching for a house-this just goes to indicate the economy stay amidst the sky rocketing hotel rates in Dubai!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LarnieCyprus
Reviews.Content: We have just had a great stay at this hotel. The room was clean, the food was good. The staff were wonderful,very helpful and kind. we would stay there again in future. Alana and John Beardmore. Cyprus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Nimu
Reviews.Content: Savoy is a very pleasant, clean and inviting hotel. The staff give very personalized service and for those that would have a long engagement in Dubai you will find yourself well treated. The room service is also very good with reasonable quality food. They also serve a reasonable breakfast. I highly recommend it. The size of the rooms and bathrooms are abit small but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, small hotel good value for money”
Reviews.Author: baf65
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed for 2nights at the Savoy Park with my partner and 20mth old. The hotel itself is fairly basic but our room was clean (we had a studio apartment) and suited our needs of having space for our little boy to run around and a kitchen. The bathroom was only small with just a shower but that was fine for 2 nights. The staff were very welcoming and we were allowed to check in to our room at 8am when we arrived. We were supplied with a cot. WE got daily fruit platter and biscuits and nothing was too much trouble from the housekeeping staff. Our rate included breakfast which was fine, a mixture of some western and arabic food. The restaurant itself is clean and tidy and the staff were really friendly and welcoming to our child - there was only 1 highchair tho'! All the reception staff were pleasant to us and I have no complaints about any of the service we received there. The pool area was well shaded and clean, probably not that large come the cooler weather when more people would be using the pool area but suited our needs. I would stay at this hotel again if I visited in the height of summer as we knew we wouldnt be able to make use of all the facilities of the larger resorts given the intense heat. We always found it easy to get taxis to the souks and malls, just dont head to the gold souk at 6pm as the traffic was horrendous!!

HotelInfo.Name: Savoy Park Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 317 Community 10 B Street | Bur Dubai, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
